title: Ticket #5664: Review usage of getHostFromAddr().
description:
[See #5659 for the genesis of this ticket.]

I'm concerned about not using the Sinful class to do the parsing in getHostFromAddr(); we've already got at least one Sinful format (v1) that it won't handle correctly, and we may make it (or a further revision) the default at some point.

We should also take a look at who calls getHostFromAddr(); callers who know they're looking at Sinful strings should just use the Sinful object, instead. This may simplify things. (The Sinful object may also have "hostname:port" parsing in it for backwards compatibility...) If we do need getHostFromAddr(), it should probably use the Sinful object.

We should also worry about why the callers are obtaining the host name (or IP address -- in the Sinful parlance, the primary address), since we can no longer assume, with shared port and CCB, that those are unique identifiers.
